website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive mortar and pestle set made of porcelain that's perfect for the budding chef.
pros: High sides prevent ingredients being ground inside from falling over the sides
Smaller size makes it easy to store
Can be run through the dishwasher for cleanup
cons: It's porcelain, so it's a little delicate, according to some reviewers

customer_reviews.title: Not a real mortar and pestle
customer_reviews.text: This is only for people who don't know how a real mortar and pestle are supposed to work. They are both supposed to have similar curvatures so that there is good contact between the two pieces. In this set, the pestle has a curved end (as it should), but the mortar has straight sides and a flat bottom, making for minimal contact between it and the pestle. So this might be okay for simply smashing something small (like a pill), but it's pretty useless for grinding something (like spices).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This should be free! $9 and it's smaller than the palm of my hand. I cannot crush any thing but one pill and it falling out if my hand. It holds about 2 ounces and 2 pills. This was a waste of money, time, and energy. It's smaller than my shot glass.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Very Small
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have read the specifications more closely and used a ruler to check the size before I purchased. This is VERY small. Could be a great toy for a child but much too small to be practical
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: It was nice while it lasted but broke in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Manas Garg

customer_reviews.title: Great Mortar and Pestle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to crush up spices fresh for recipes in the kitchen and I am very happy with it. It has a textured base and end on the pestle so that things don't just fly out from under it. It works very well and is very easily washed out when you have finished. I love the finish of it as well, we are very picky about our kitchen utensils and we want everything to be a plain ceramic white. This fits in perfectly. *On a side note, if you have turmeric stains just set it in the sunlight, the sunlight will remove turmeric stains.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Webb

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is the tiniest weakest option possible. If you need to crush pills because you can’t swallow them look elsewhere as this pestle will break immediately. Ceramic and not stone
customer_reviews.author: Violetheaven

customer_reviews.title: Not good for pills
customer_reviews.text: Not good for crushing pills. The inside of the bowl, as well as the surface of the crusher, has a matte/textured surface which attracts and holds a good deal of the pill ingredients. I was hopeful the porcelain surface would be hard and smooth. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: NickdeckTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It holds more of the crushed vitamin then I'm comfortable with. Had it been smooth the entire crushed ...
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the other reviewer who didn't appreciate the texture on the inside. I really don't understand the need for a rough interior. It holds more of the crushed vitamin then I'm comfortable with. Had it been smooth the entire crushed vitamin would have easily poured into another container. That said, I really like the small size. It does indeed crush the vitamin into powder. It is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Simple and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to crush up my dog's meds. She has a way of eating around them and refuses to take them orally. So, I crush them up and sprinkle them on her food. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: James Fay

customer_reviews.title: This will be helpful in kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a mortar and pestle for years and finally ordered this one. The seller did describe this as about two inches wide (there was a larger one, too), and so I can't complain. It is very small and I wish I had ordered the larger one. It will work for what I wanted, nonetheless, and it doesn't take up much room! I crushed dried rosemary leaves with it and it worked well. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: PA female

customer_reviews.title: Small but really great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for grinding bug bites for my fish, and it works great. It is on the small size and has some texture to the surfaces for grinding to keep things inside the bowl. It is on the small size but thats whats great about it for small things. It doesnt feel cheap or low quality and works great. Cleaning is easy even with the textured surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: necromstr69

customer_reviews.title: Just look at the picture and you will be pissed
customer_reviews.text: I’m not mentioning nothing good about this.....wowwwww “easy to hold”? Are you even serious, more like easy to get carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.author: 😑

customer_reviews.title: A Mortar & Pestle
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this I saw that people had complained about the size in their reviews so I decided to go with the 3.5’. It’s big enough for me and it does exactly what it’s supposed to. My only nitpicky complaint is that there's a lump at the tip of the pestle, it’s not completely round. Other than that it’s a nice mortar and pestle.
customer_reviews.author: Jamelia O

customer_reviews.title: Ideal size and surface quality
customer_reviews.text: Grinding pills to include in Boost is a breeze with this small, convenient device, especially when the surface lends itself to releasing ALL of the medication into the drink. Storage space is no problem given the smallness of this device and it's easy to pack for trips, too.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much perfect for my uses
customer_reviews.text: Big enough for kitchen spices and small amounts of snuff; sturdy enough to survive less than careful use on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Noble

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is small only 3 in. dia. perfect for crushing pills. That's what I bought it for and it works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W

customer_reviews.title: Teeny tiny
customer_reviews.text: This was so much smaller than we'd envisioned Might work to grind up one pill at a time or a few peppercorns, but looks more like something for a child to play with in a dollhouse. We ordered a different one- the stainless steel one with a lid, and it is amazing!! We suggest skipping this one and finding that one here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: High Hopes

customer_reviews.title: The pestle is long enough for a comfortable grip. I use this mortar and pestle to ...
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of looking before choosing a mortar and pestle and finally ended up going with this one. The inside of the mortar is rough. The pestle is long enough for a comfortable grip. I use this mortar and pestle to crush herbs and spices for chai. It takes a little getting used to, but don't go by the size for how much it holds. If you put more than a tablespoon of anything in there it will spill out as you're crushing it.
customer_reviews.author: deetergirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Pill Crusher
customer_reviews.text: This mortar and pestle works great for crushing pills. My dog needed some pills that were too big for him to eat so I bought one of these and used it to crush his pills. He took the crushed pills with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The bottom was very gritty creating a problem after crushing, things would stick to the bottom
customer_reviews.author: alyssa jill dismukes

customer_reviews.title: Too small for bones
customer_reviews.text: Was very surprised to find that this pestle and mortar was manual, had entirely expected this to work automatically by the demons which this was used to summon. Plain in appearance and kind of small, nowhere near large enough to grind any but the smallest of bones, a definite downside, but it's easy to clean the blood and ash up, and will definitely work in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Grey

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a small mortar and pestle, but super sturdy and large enough for my minimal spice grinding needs. I really only use it for grinding coriander occasionally to make a dipping sauce for fish. Buy a larger set if you are preparing multiple herbs/spices for even a family of 4's portions.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sixkiller

customer_reviews.title: Very delicate and fragile
customer_reviews.text: It is so delicate that with some painting n flowers it cd be used as glass crockery. Let alone a mortar and pestle... which requires force and pressure. This delicate bowl seems as if it would Crack with slightest touch... let alone survive the banging of a pestle
customer_reviews.author: Sabz

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and does its job
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for a friend who needed one for medicinal purposes. So far he's loving it and it has made his life much easier. If you're looking for an affordable but sturdy mortar & pestle, this is the way to go. Even though most wooden mortar & pestles I looked at were cheaper, I would not suggest buying one unless you're crushing something very soft and don't care about cross-contamination, ease of cleaning, or durability. Porcelain or stone is the only way to roll.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this product as the bowl itself is not glazed and that is what I needed. However this little mortar and pestle is great for kitchen use. It was way more sturdy than I had supposed based on its size.
customer_reviews.author: SAM3

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first mortar and pestle. I use it to pulverize pills that my little dog needs to take. After the pills are in powder form, thanks to the mortar and pestle, I can easily mix them into her food. The HIC mortar and pestle is perfect for my needs and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marilee L.

customer_reviews.title: The smallest thing you’ll ever see in your life 😡
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know even where to begin. This thing shouldn’t be even sell as a toy. Is so small that a cup of espresso is bigger than that. it’s soooooo ridiculous That I don’t have words to describe. I’m so upset I never leave bad reviews but this is so ridiculous and now I have to waste my gas to return this thing to UPS for me to get the eight dollars is in sane. thank you so much for selling the worst thing ever you can buy online
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Alright for cost
customer_reviews.text: I use it for basil and it's alright. It worked for really dry ingredients and if the leaves had any moisture it wouldnt grind. Once completely dry tho I was able to make a fine powder. Ordered 2 as my 2nd one is being used to grind potassium nitrate into a much finer powder for use in rocket fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best deal out there
customer_reviews.text: Not only was this the best deal on Amazon, it also has a pour spout and is a sturdy, nice set. It is big enough for my needs and does not need to be a huge, expensive set.
customer_reviews.author: b.nicole

customer_reviews.title: Functional, and apparently a show stopper.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a mortar and pestle for awhile now, as I wanted one to grind up spices. Some of my friends suggested getting an electric one, but there's something quite satisfying about doing it by hand. I'm really happy I picked this one, and I was astonished how many family members were talking about it as if it were the show stopper of our Thanksgiving dinner--not even kidding! Easy to clean, easy to use, and for some reason it's a show stopper. ;)
customer_reviews.author: petitemousie

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard small mortar and pestle set. They work well and don't break the bank so they get a good review in my book. They are small but if you are just throwing together some spices for cooking or some incense, its actually a nice little size. I like that it fits in my palm comfortably and I can really grind with them. If you need a large set this is not the one. If you are looking to grind really hard items, this probably won't work. But if you are just using it for the normal small stuff, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Karina w

customer_reviews.title: Only for the stubborn who can't take advice
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this. It has thousands of small ruff pores that your product gets trapped in. It's waisting my time and money. I will only use this from now on for liquid. The wond I will use for paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Peggy lyvp

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any home.
customer_reviews.text: The item is great and I am happy I have it. It's very useful for a variety of things, be that pills or ingredients that i need to puverize.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but pretty
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny little bowl but perfect for what I wanted which was to crush up a dog pill. It seems very sturdy and it’s pretty. I doubt anyone would use such a tiny bowl for cooking but for crushing 1-2 maybe 3 pills it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Drifter

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, quality, fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase. It's sleek and fancy looking while remaining nicely simple looking. Grinds very well with the texture on the bottoms of both parts. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: A little smaller than I thought it would be. Great for spices, not as good for mashing hot peppers
customer_reviews.author: B M

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife can’t swallow pills so this was used to crush them up. Our previous one broke after a few years of not very regular use; however the value was enough we bought another!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great for grinding herbs
customer_reviews.text: I used this to grind the herbs from my garden to make soaps. I love it because it’s easy to clean, small enough to use anywhere and doesn’t absorb the oils so I can use for all of my herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Shirlene H.

customer_reviews.title: Pestle was filthy
customer_reviews.text: For something that's supposed to be new, I was quite disappointed that the pestle came with black marks, so I start off with something already causing purity issues
customer_reviews.author: Mile Hi Dave

customer_reviews.title: small but fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a small mortar and pestle but it works just fine for grinding my little dog's meds. I could see using it for grinding seeds and small spices etc. The top circumference is about 2".
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Landsburg

customer_reviews.title: Great mortar and pestle for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for my adult daughter to grind dried herbs for her ramen. Yeah, that's exactly, and ONLY, what it's used for. LOL She loves it and uses it almost daily since I bought it a few months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Brant

customer_reviews.title: Witks
customer_reviews.text: I had a &16 plastic pill crusher that did a good job but Brock after a month. The mortal works well. You can get a nice powder trim pills or vitamins
customer_reviews.author: Angela nakayama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pill crusher!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect item to crush my Herbalife liftoff tablets for my daily tea. It had really made my mornings a lot easier. My dad wants one now for the kitchen to crush his herbs so I may be purchasing a second one shortly. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Verna

customer_reviews.title: Price and delivery were great !
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for its intended use . Couldn't be more satisfied .
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Ballinger

customer_reviews.title: Dirty! Much smaller than expected, read and understand the dimensions first.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the small brown box the first thing I noticed was not only the size but the dust and dirt inside of the bowl and the bowl itself was not wrapped in bubble wrap although the pestle itself was. I thought 'Oh, maybe it's just some dust or something from the small brown box.' until I unwrapped the pestle and the end was somehow even dirtier. It works well but the fact it arrived dirty is extremely bothersome and worrying.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for on some things. smaller than I wanted. even if I used it in the kitchen, it wouldn't do the job. its an ok buy if you know the size youre getting
customer_reviews.author: kimberly hoogewind

customer_reviews.title: Makes it easy to crumble up a pill.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job really well. The inside is rough so the contented don't slide around when crushing it up, however, it makes it slightly more difficult to clean. A good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Coder80

customer_reviews.title: Just as described and pictured
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed with a pour spout that holds the pestle in storage. Heavy porcelain, glazed where it should be, but not on the grinding surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskaguy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are very smart, and just cutting up their pills and trying to hide them in food was not working. This works perfectly, easy to crush pills, and now my dogs don't know they are being treated. Easy to use, well built, good price and fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: Rick R. Cagle

customer_reviews.title: Buyer should be aware
customer_reviews.text: This item was very small a lot smaller than I originally thought and it did not perform as well as I thought it would buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Chamil

customer_reviews.title: Small Mortar and Pestle
customer_reviews.text: This Mortar and Pestle is perfect for people who only need to use one on rare occasions. If you have a regular need for one you may want to get a bigger version.
customer_reviews.author: MandBinc

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice size I love the color the price and it works well. I am very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jones

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Mortar and Pestle. Great for grinding saffron
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to grind saffron. It is small and convenient. I will recommend this to anyone who is looking to grind small things like pills, saffron and other herbs.
customer_reviews.author: RamMuljani

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged and promptly delivered with satisfactory tracking. Mortar/Pestle work for partly crushing peanuts, but the grinding surfaces are not finished to the gloss surface of the outside surfaces, so there is a tendency for the grindings to stick to the inside of the mortar and end of the pestle--I realize there is a reason for this---just saying, ya know.
customer_reviews.author: ets

customer_reviews.title: Tinny
customer_reviews.text: It's really small. I think it'll be big enough to crush one pill at a time. Plus I don't understand the easy-to-swallow question.
customer_reviews.author: Itsme

customer_reviews.title: Dainty
customer_reviews.text: The surface on the outside is polished, and the inside is unpolished, which provides good friction. I will say that even after reading the size online, it’s still somehow smaller than I expected. It would be suitable maybe for crushing small spices or pills but I think it’s not very good for making larger mixtures or pastes for cooking. I’ll probably invest in a larger and heavier version for that purpose later.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: The teeny, tiny mortar and pestle
customer_reviews.text: The picture on Amazon sure made me think I was ordering something for an adult, not a Munchkin. I'll have to use my pill cutter to make the pills small enough to fit into this. I'd be upset if the sight of this didn't make me laugh out loud.
customer_reviews.author: MegsMom

customer_reviews.title: Mine is the 2.5" size. Nice small set, well made.
customer_reviews.text: Nice small little set, perfect for grinding my cat's medication for mixing with unsalted chicken stock (stock works well for this fyi). The pouring lip is just an indentation in the side, but I think a mortar does not need a pouring lip, I just scoop and scrape the ground powder out anyway. My item looks exactly like the picture, except you can't see the pouring lip indentation in the picture, the pestle might be leaning on the lip. Good item, cost me $8.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for pill crushing and for leaf/spice crushing. Easy to store. Could even fit in flatware drawer
customer_reviews.author: Cindy T

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This is super time. Smaller than I expected. Like smaller than a Japanese tea cup. Very difficult to hold the little grinder. But I just kept it. It is not what I expected but for the price I am going to just use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny decorative item made to grind only a pinch of herbs... Useless in the kitchen! For decorative purposes only.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Tiny!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s the tiniest thing you could possible buy to crush anything! Here’s a picture next to my espresso cup. 🤦🏻‍♀️ Don’t buy it if you actually need it to work. If it’s just for decor maybe, only if you don’t have small children.
customer_reviews.author: Ayli San Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Useful in the Kitchen and for Medications
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little mortar and pestle to split my larger pull medications, which I can add to applesauce. It’s also great for grinding up small amounts of herbs and spices. It’s durable, doesn’t stain, and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Broke in half after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Broke in half. Not very sturdy. Does crush pills well when it's still in tact. And the price has triples since January. Not cool at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: It's Tiny.  Like really really small.  Not a normal size M&P
customer_reviews.text: We've used it once, I wish it was the size of a normal grinder. Easy to swallow, is a perfect 5 star because it is EASY TO SWALLOW. the pestle is so small, you could swallow it (not for children).
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Watch the size it is not very big
customer_reviews.text: A bit small but works well for what I need
customer_reviews.author: evonne

customer_reviews.title: I guess it works.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what the issue is exactly but I feel as if it is not as effective as I had hoped. Maybe because it’s smaller than I expected and I can’t get a proper grip on the mortar part but I feel like I’m not grinding the herbs like I want
customer_reviews.author: Catie

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for grinding pills. Use in a clinic & it makes things loads easier. Super quick to clean & tiny so it’s easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Allyssa Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Look like a fool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these mortar and pestle as gifts for employees, and only two came with a pestle. Not sure how you forget to send all of the product, but definitely a disappointment when a gift can't be used. Made me look like a fool.
customer_reviews.author: John LEancu

customer_reviews.title: My first mortar and pestle, and I really like it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time to grind up coffee grounds to make a finer crystal for a homemade coffee scrub. It made quick work of the job and I didn't notice any chalk or residue left behind. The pour spout is super convenient as well and helped me get the powder into the jar and not all over the counter. I threw it in the dishwasher after and it cleaned up like new. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Wiz

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  High Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use this to grind green tea. It works great. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Was it easy to swallow?
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller then I thought, but it works great. A question you asked, was it easy to swallow? I'm not gonna try to swallow a pastel & mortar set not even on a dare! Lol!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: This is a very small mortar and pestle, and so it will not be useful for everything. However, it is super hard porcelain and will probably last forever. It was literally shipped to me in an unpadded paper envelope, and it survived the journey unscathed. I used it to crush up pills, and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Surfbored

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to crush pills, and to crush herbs for oils. Works great & is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JACKIE HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: it's ok but small
customer_reviews.text: it's much smaller than i anticipated, difficult to hold small pestle for grinding up fenugreek seeds, stc
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and works great
customer_reviews.text: Cleans well. Even red iron oxide came right off the abrasive areas. Well pleased, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Conveniently snall
customer_reviews.text: Ideal size for small amounts of spices or herbs, without taking up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph E.

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Fragile and ineffective. Pester & mortar Do not work well together. could not crush cardamom seeds.
customer_reviews.author: robby

customer_reviews.title: Too small not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Too small. Too expansive for the size. But kinda cute
customer_reviews.author: Nameless

customer_reviews.title: smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller than I'd thought it would be. But it is surly serving it's purpose so no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: John Cowart

customer_reviews.title: Good size for most grindig needs
customer_reviews.text: This mortar and pestle is a good shape and the pestle smoothly grinds herbs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Magda G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for grinding spices
customer_reviews.text: Like the smaller size. Didn't need a larger one for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: RVer

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: photo is deceptive, as looks like it should hold half cup and it only holds about 2 tablespoons Not happy, pure junk

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect
customer_reviews.text: ..., but, be aware that it is tiny. Great for crushing pills. Not so great for herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sil

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: poor workmanship and fragile (oxymoronic for a crusher to be extremely fragile)
customer_reviews.author: Deepak

customer_reviews.title: Sides are not curved properly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to crush my meds. But as one of the reviews before said, the sides are not curved enough. Some reviews were good so I thought I'd give it a try. We just use it for a back up now when the other one needs washing.
customer_reviews.author: L Silva

customer_reviews.title: tablet to fine powder in no time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dogs glucosamine. I can get the tablet in a very fine powder. Powder easily mixes with food... Quick and easy...
customer_reviews.author: PoolFixer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mortar and Pestle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom, who takes care of my sick father. She absolutely loves it. She uses it to crush up his medicine and it works perfectly. She has to crush some pills that are huge and thick and this does the job perfectly. It crushes them in seconds and it is a great size. If you're using it to crush medicine, I would definitely get this one because it has the pour spout. It helps a lot when you need to get very finely crushed pills out of it without spilling them everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: PlaidShirtDays

customer_reviews.title: Guac inspired!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to ground up my spices for guac - this is PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great to smash my dogs pills so he will take them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grinds Tablets To Fine Powder!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this in the mail, and pleased that I got it so fast. I immediately took it out and used it to crush Vitamin C tablets, and it worked like a charm. I was able to grind the tablets to a fine powder, and the little spout made pouring it out a breeze. I can tell I'm going to love having this.
customer_reviews.author: lovebird

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: It's very small, a frequently useful size for spices. Cleans easily. The pestle is too small to be of any use--I just tossed it and used one from the big molcajete that I like for making pesto.
customer_reviews.author: Sassafras

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and does the Job easily.
customer_reviews.text: This fits perfectly in your hand and it is very easy to use to crush even large pills. Just a little pressure and a twist of your hand and the pill crumbles. From there, it is so easy to make the pill as powdered as you would like. You can't see it in the picture, but there is a little pour spout that makes it easy to get the contents out once they are crushed. This item is of very high quality and I don't think I will ever need to purchase another. I can't see why anyone would want to have a bigger one as this is a good size.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Small but efficient!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to crush pills for my elderly mother. Works great and good price! This is not an easy thing to find! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Quilter I Am

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to grind up my cat’s medicines into a powder.
customer_reviews.author: 419er

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED & WORKS GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to check out the size of the product because it is probably smaller than predicted, however this is an AWESOME PRODUCT!! Works great and crushes huge pills so easily into a fine powder. I take my pills with food and it grinds the pill down so much to where I cannot taste it when I mix it with food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Pill Crusher
customer_reviews.text: I wish the bottom had been glazed, bits of medicine tend to stick on the bottom so I have to scrape it out with a spoon. Other than that, I am pretty happy with it. It is really small, perfect for crushing just a pill or two.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in NC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little set! I have to crush my dog's meds so I can hide them in his food.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: it is smaller than i thought but it suits my needs, have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Morton and pastel
customer_reviews.text: THOUGHT was bigger. But still does what it needs to just way smaller portions.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

product_meta.title: HIC Mortar and Pestle Spice Herb Grinder Pill Crusher, Fine-Quality Porcelain
product_meta.description:
Size:3.5-Inches

HIC’s Mortar and Pestle Set is the perfect tool to grind items into a fine paste or powder. The mortar bowl and pestle work together to grind and break down ingredients quickly. It’s a helpful addition to kitchen items for speeding up food preparation with minimum effort. Quickly grind fresh ingredients, like cloves of garlic, herbs and spices, peppercorns or cinnamon, nuts, grains, and seeds, into a fine paste or powder. Make aromatic dry rubs, curry pastes, pestos, nut butters, spreads, and so much more. Even use it as a pill crusher to pulverize harder-to-swallow pills! Essential tools for those practicing homeopathy, the art of healing through natural remedies, HIC’s Mortar and Pestle Set offers effortless preparation of herbal and homeopathic remedies. So easy to use. Simply place an item into the mortar bowl. Hold the pestle by the handle and, using a firm pressure, make a circular stirring-like motion to grind your item into a paste or powder. Harder items, like peppercorns, may need the surface cracked before they can be ground. Firmly, but gently, tap the item with the pestle, then grind into the desired consistency. Pestle and mortar are both made from fine-quality porcelain to complement kitchen countertops and any home decor. Dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
feature_bullets: HIC’s Mortar and Pestle Set for grinding items into a fine paste or powder
Made from fine-quality porcelain; complements any decor; mortar 3.5 x 1.75-inches; pestle 4-inches
Quickly grind and break down ingredients; speeds up food preparation with minimum effort
Make aromatic dry rubs, curry pastes, pestos, nut butters, ground cinnamon or grind peppercorns, prepare holistic remedies, pulverize pills, and more
Easy to use and clean; dishwasher safe for easy cleanup
